alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 25 at 8:15AM EST until January 25 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations ranging from a coating to an inch or two west of the Allegheny Front with 2 to 5 inches along and east of the Allegheny Front. Ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch, mainly west of the Allegheny Front. A light glaze of ice is expected elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 7 PM EST Wednesday. Snow and sleet will overspread the area between 5 AM and 8 AM. Precipitation will change to freezing rain by mid morning for areas west of the Allegheny Front. Elsewhere, precipitation will change to rain between 1 and 3 PM Wednesday afternoon. Rain may freeze on a few surfaces before temperatures rise above freezing late in the day. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute and possibly the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
